website_summaries.verdict: Western Digital's My Cloud EX4 is a good introductory NAS for small offices, offering very good drive and data recovery, easy remote access, and basic business NAS features. It is not, however, ideal for larger SMBs or those requiring very high-performance storage.

customer_reviews.text: I have a network of 6 desktops and 2 laptops and this unit will only work with 1 machine instructions are crap as unit is not giving me the screens shown ,Uploading is next to useless even Western Digital support pages are a mess and do not give you any help , have a good mind to return it to amazon as useless bit of junk you cannot access it from a network and nobody at western digital will talk to you

customer_reviews.title: Excellent easy to use product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, bought with some trepidation as I am not an IT guru. Also purchased 4 x 4TB WD Red disks which fitted without issues. This unit is sturdily built using mainly sheet metal and once fitted with disks weighs a significant amount. Shouldn't have worried about the set-up as using the UI and My Cloud software made setting the RAID configuration and loading my files very easy. Now running as a home NAS with several TB's of Movies plus more TB's of photo's and music all served up to my Amazon Fire TV using the Plex media server. Usage to date (2wks): so far has proven unobtrusive, fast, reliable and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Phill993

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bit of kit. Set up straight forward. Automatic Firmware update downloaded/installed within minutes of connecting the internet. WD software is excellent (No glitches yet). Running Raid 5 + 1 with 4 x 4TB WD Reds. Have used other makes of NAS enclosures in the past but always had difficulty setting up remote access. Remote access to the EX4100 is easy & straight forward to setup, well done WD. Update: It's now December 2018 and I have not had a problem. (Just incase you were wondering about durability)
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Shorten

customer_reviews.title: Works, but wouldn't buy again or recommend
customer_reviews.text: The online interface refuses to log in unless there's no password. Setup isn't very user-friendly and there's little to explain how to configure the drives. The fact that there are public folders on the drive that can't be removed is very annoying, as is the auto-categorisation of all media that gets added to the drive. The NAS works, so I will keep it, but were I to do this again I definitely won't buy a WD NAS, which is a pity as I exclusively buy WD hard drives and am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade to my much older WD Cloud/Terrastation combo.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace two existing NAS setups with much smaller drives. Only been running a week, but it's a robust device and I've had no problems with it. The excellent web interface made it easy to set up, including an FTP job to transfer the files from the TerraStation across whilst I sleep or working on the PC. So much quicker than previous attempts via Windows file copying. Being able to spread across 5 monthly payments also helps me to pay for it, without a massive lump going out the account in one go.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mee

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, not worth your money.
customer_reviews.text: Do no buy. Whilst good value, this NAS is more hassle than it is worth. My first machine suffered intermittent Cooling fan failure. This was replaced (good service here although I had to pay postage to return) the replacement now completely freezes. Disconnecting itself from the network and forcing you to unplug it (not good for the health of the drives!) Spend your money elsewhere. Maybe give Synology or QNAP a go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased by EX4100 a couple of years ago, but recently after a number of firmware updates, the system just hangs once every 4-5 days or so. No network access, no response from the buttons on the device.. the solution is to pull the power cord, re-start it and wait for the disc checking process to finish. A quick search online shows that MANY users are experiencing exactly the same thing, and have been for some three years.. the response from WD - Nothing! I would seriously recommend you do some research before parting with your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nothing But Trouble And No Support From WD
customer_reviews.text: This unit has caused me nothing but trouble. Since the get-go. There has been issue after issue with every aspect of it and having to get someone in to fix it every time has caused no end of disruption to my work. I wish I'd listened to the reviews and bought a Synology.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic safe network storage.
customer_reviews.text: This Western Digital My Cloud Network Access Storage is a fantastic device. It's very straightforward to set up and very easy to use. I use it to keep all my music, photographs and films and can access them wherever I am from my iPhone, iPad and Apple Mac laptop. Some bits are already preset when you first set it up and you just need to tweak a few settings here and there. Most importantly I have confidence that all my files are protected and safe with a trusted name in storage like Western Digital. Every home should have one.
